content: @Reid Barton @Johan Commelin Are you happy with my changes?
There are almost no changes right? Or am I missing something. I would say... let's merge this.
I don't really understand what's going on here...
@Simon Hudon You are changing mathlib... so that it compiles with 3.5.0c? And it also still compiles with 3.4.2? How does that work? One of them wants two instances and the other only one...

That's right, it will compile with both. It broke because the instance was being fed its assumptions explicitly. I made it so that the instance can get the assumptions explicitly regardless of how many it needs.
One thought: maybe a docstring is in order so people will know about this going forward?
Oh, I hadn't thought about the need to make it compile with both Lean 3.4.2 and 3.5.0c. Makes sense now
Also yeah, comments around weird compatibility hacks are always helpful.
